List.Name: Staff Responsible distance information from loop
Track Condition Change of traction system
Track Condition Change of allowed current consumption
Data used by applications outside the ERTMS/ETCS system.
List of balises for SH Area
List of Balises in SR Authority
Inhibition of revocable TSRs from balises in L2/3
Packet for sending plain text messages
Packet for sending fixed text messages
Track Ahead Free up to level 2/3 transition location
Default Gradient for Temporary Speed Restriction
Session Management with neighbouring Radio Infill Unit
Inhibition of balise group message consistency reaction
Default balise or loop or RIU information

Packet.Name: Virtual Balise Cover marker
Packet.Description: Indication to on-board that the telegram can be ignored according to a VBC

Packet.Name: System Version order
Packet.Description: This packet is used to tell the on-board which is the operated system version

Packet.Name: National Values
Packet.Description: Downloads a set of National Values to the train

TlgVar.Name: NID_C
TlgVar.Comment: Identification of national areas to which the set applies

TlgVar.Name: NID_C(p)
TlgVar.Comment: Identification of additional national area(s) to which the set applies

TlgVar.Name: Q_NVKVINTSET
TlgVar.Comment: Only if Q_NVKINT = 1, Q_NVKVINTSET and the following variables follow

TlgVar.Name: M_NVKVINT
TlgVar.Comment: Valid between V_NVKVINT and V_NVKVINT(1)If Q_NVKVINTSET = 1, gives the correction factor if maximum emergency brake deceleration is lower than A_NVP12

TlgVar.Name: M_NVKVINT(n)
TlgVar.Comment: Valid between V_NVKVINT(n) and V_NVKVINT(n+1)If Q_NVKVINTSET = 1, gives the correction factor if maximum emergency brake deceleration is lower than A_NVP12

TlgVar.Name: M_NVKVINT(k)
TlgVar.Comment: If Q_NVKVINTSET(k) = 1; Valid between V_NVKVINT(k) and V_NVKVINT(k,1). Gives the correction factor if maximum emergency brake deceleration is lower than A_NVP12(k).

TlgVar.Name: M_NVKVINT(k,m)
TlgVar.Comment: If Q_NVKVINTSET(k) = 1.Valid between V_NVKVINT(k,m) and V_NVKVINT(k,m+1)gives the correction factor if maximum emergency brake deceleration is lower than A_NVP12(k)

Packet.Name: Linking
Packet.Description: Linking Information.

Packet.Name: Virtual Balise Cover order
Packet.Description: The packet sets/removes a Virtual Balise Cover.

Packet.Name: Level 1 Movement Authority
Packet.Description: Transmission of a movement authority for level 1.

TlgVar.Name: N_ITER
TlgVar.Comment: Set to zero if V_MAIN = 0 or if only one section in the MA

Packet.Name: Staff Responsible distance Information from loop
Packet.Description: Information for trains in staff responsible mode

Packet.Name: Level 2/3 Movement Authority
Packet.Description: Transmission of a movement authority for levels 2/3.

TlgVar.Name: N_ITER
TlgVar.Comment: Set to zero if only one section in the MA

Packet.Name: Repositioning Information
Packet.Description: Transmission of the update of the current distance

Packet.Name: Gradient Profile
Packet.Description: Transmission of the gradient.D_GRADIENT gives the distance to the next change of the gradient value. The gradient value is the minimum gradient for the given distance.

Packet.Name: International Static Speed Profile
Packet.Description: Static speed profile and optionally speed limits depending on the international train category.

Packet.Name: Track Condition Change of traction system
Packet.Description: The packet gives information about change of the traction system.

TlgVar.Name: NID_CTRACTION
TlgVar.Comment: only if M_VOLTAGE != 0 Identity of the traction system NID_CTRACTION given

Packet.Name: Track Condition Change of allowed current consumption
Packet.Description: The packet gives information about change of the allowed current consumption.

Packet.Name: Level Transition Order
Packet.Description: Packet to identify where a level transition shall take place. In case of mixed levels, the successive M_LEVELTR go from the highest priority level to the lowest one.

Packet.Name: Session Management
Packet.Description: Packet to give the identity and telephone number of the RBC with which a session shall be established or terminated.

TlgVar.Name: NID_C
TlgVar.Comment: RBC ETCS identity : NID_C not relevant if NID_RBC has value 'Contact last known RBC'

TlgVar.Name: NID_RADIO
TlgVar.Comment: not relevant if NID_RBC has value 'Contact last known RBC'

Packet.Name: Data used by applications outside the ERTMS/ETCS system
Packet.Description: Messages between trackside and on-board devices, which contain information used by applications outside the ERTMS/ETCS system.

Packet.Name: Radio Network registration
Packet.Description: Packet to give the identity of the Radio Network to which a registration shall be enforced.

Packet.Name: Conditional Level Transition Order
Packet.Description: Packet for a conditional level transition. The successive M_LEVELTR go from the highest priority level to the lowest one.

Packet.Name: List of balises for SH Area
Packet.Description: Used to list balise group(s) which the train can pass over in SH mode

Packet.Name: Axle Load Speed Profile
Packet.Description: This packet gives the speed restrictions for trains with axle load category higher than or equal to the specified value for the speed restriction

TlgVar.Name: D_AXLELOAD
TlgVar.Comment: Only if Q_TRACKINIT = 0D_AXLELOAD and the following variables follow

TlgVar.Name: V_AXLELOAD(n)
TlgVar.Comment: Speed restriction to be applied if the axle load category of the train ( M_AXLELOADCAT(n)

TlgVar.Name: V_AXLELOAD(k,m)
TlgVar.Comment: Speed restriction to be applied if the axle load category of the train ( M_AXLELOADCAT(k,m)

Packet.Name: Permitted Braking Distance Information
Packet.Description: This packet requests the on-board calculation of speed restrictions which ensure a given permitted brake distance in case of an EB, or SB, intervention

TlgVar.Name: D_PBD
TlgVar.Comment: Only if Q_TRACKINIT = 0 D_PBD and the following variables follow

TlgVar.Name: G_PBDSR
TlgVar.Comment: Gradient value to be used for the calculation

TlgVar.Name: G_PBDSR(k)
TlgVar.Comment: Gradient value to be used for the calculation

Packet.Name: Movement Authority Request Parameters
Packet.Description: This packet is intended to give parameters telling when and how often the train has to ask for a movement authority.

Packet.Name: Position Report Parameters
Packet.Description: This packet is intended to give parameters telling when and how often the position has to be reported.

Packet.Name: List of Balises in SR Authority
Packet.Description: Used to list balise group(s) which the train can pass over in SR mode

Packet.Name: Inhibition of revocable TSRs from balises in L2/3
Packet.Description: This packet is used to inhibit revocable TSRs from balises in level 2 or 3.

Packet.Name: Temporary Speed Restriction
Packet.Description: Transmission of temporary speed restriction.

Packet.Name: Temporary Speed Restriction Revocation
Packet.Description: Transmission of temporary speed restriction revocation.

TlgVar.Name: NID_TSR
TlgVar.Comment: Identity of TSR to be revoked

Packet.Name: Track Condition Big Metal Masses
Packet.Description: The packet gives details concerning where to ignore integrity check alarms of balise transmission due to big metal masses trackside.

TlgVar.Name: L_TRACKCOND
TlgVar.Comment: The distance for which integrity check alarms of balise transmission shall be ignored

TlgVar.Name: L_TRACKCOND(k)
TlgVar.Comment: The distance for which integrity check alarms of balise transmission shall be ignored

Packet.Name: Track Condition
Packet.Description: The packet gives details concerning the track ahead to support the driver when e.g. lower pantograph

TlgVar.Name: D_TRACKCOND
TlgVar.Comment: Only if Q_TRACKINIT = 0D_TRACKCOND and the following variables follow

Packet.Name: Track Condition Station Platforms
Packet.Description: The packet gives details concerning the location and height of station platforms for use by the train door control system

TlgVar.Name: D_TRACKCOND
TlgVar.Comment: Only if Q_TRACKINIT = 0D_TRACKCOND and the following variables follow

Packet.Name: Route Suitability Data
Packet.Description: The packet gives the characteristics needed to enter a route.

TlgVar.Name: D_SUITABILITY
TlgVar.Comment: Only If Q_TRACKINIT = 0D_SUITABILITY and the following variables follows

Packet.Name: Adhesion factor
Packet.Description: This packet is used when the trackside requests a change of the adhesion factor to be used in the brake model.

Packet.Name: Packet for sending plain text messages
Packet for sending fixed text messages
Geographical Position Information
Packet.Description: This packet gives geographical location information for one or multiple references to the train.

Packet.Name: Mode profile
Packet.Description: Mode profile associated to an MA

Packet.Name: Level Crossing information
Packet.Description: Level Crossing information

Packet.Name: Track Ahead Free up to level 2/3 transition location
Packet.Description: Notification to on-board that track ahead is free from the balise group transmitting this information up to the level 2/3 transition location

Packet.Name: RBC transition order
Packet.Description: Packet to order an RBC transition

Packet.Name: Danger for Shunting information
Packet.Description: Transmission of the aspect of a shunting signal

Packet.Name: EOLM Packet
Packet.Description: This packet announces a loop.

Packet.Name: Stop Shunting on desk opening
Packet.Description: Packet to stop Shunting on desk opening.

Packet.Name: Infill location reference
Packet.Description: Defines location reference for all data contained in the same radio message or balise/loop telegram respectively, following this packet.

Packet.Name: Stop if in Staff Responsible
Packet.Description: Information to stop a train in staff responsible.

Packet.Name: Reversing area information
Packet.Description: Used to send start and length of reversing area to the on-board

Packet.Name: Reversing supervision information
Packet.Description: Used to send supervision parameters (distance to run, speed) of reversing area to the on-board

Packet.Name: Train running number from RBC
Packet.Description: Train running number from RBC

Packet.Name: Default Gradient for Temporary Speed Restriction
Packet.Description: It defines a default gradient to be used for TSR supervision when no gradient profile (packet 21) is available

Packet.Name: Session Management with neighbouring Radio Infill Unit
Packet.Description: Packet to give the identity and telephone number of the neighbouring Radio Infill Unit with which a session shall be established or terminated.

Packet.Name: Inhibition of balise group message consistency reaction
Packet.Description: Indication to on-board that the balise group message consistency reaction (service brake command) can be inhibited for this balise group message only, in case one or more balise telegram(s) of the group is/are missed or is/are detected but not decoded.

Packet.Name: Default balise or Loop or RIU information
Packet.Description: Indication to on-board that balise telegram, loop message or RIU information contains default information due to a fault of the trackside equipment.

List.Name: Position Report based on two balise groups
Data used by applications outside the ERTMS or ETCS system

Packet.Name: Position Report
Packet.Description: This packet is used to report the train position and speed as well as some additional information (e.g. mode, level, etc.)

Packet.Name: Position Report based on two balise groups
Packet.Description: This packet is an extension of the 'standard position report ' packet 0. It is used in case of single balise groups if the orientation of the LRBG is unknown but the on-board equipment is able to report a second balise group (the one detected before) to give a direction reference for the directional information in the position report.

TlgVar.Name: NID_PRVLRBG
TlgVar.Comment: Used as reference for all directional information in the packet: a move from PRVLRBG towards the LRBG defines the 'nominal' direction

TlgVar.Name: Q_DIRLRBG
TlgVar.Comment: Train orientation according to reference direction

TlgVar.Name: Q_DLRBG
TlgVar.Comment: Train front position according to reference direction

TlgVar.Name: Q_DIRTRAIN
TlgVar.Comment: Actual running direction according to reference direction

Packet.Name: Onboard telephone numbers
Packet.Description: Telephone numbers associated to the onboard equipment

Packet.Name: Error reporting
Packet.Description: Error reporting to the RBC

Packet.Name: Train running number
Packet.Description: Train running number

Packet.Name: Level 2/3 transition information
Packet.Description: Identity of the level 2/3 transition balise group

Packet.Name: Validated train data
Packet.Description: Validated train data.

Packet.Name: Data used by applications outside the ERTMS or ETCS system
Packet.Description: Messages between on-board and trackside devices, which contain information used by applications outside the ERTMS or ETCS system.

Packet.Name: End of Information
Packet.Description: This packet consists only of NID_PACKET containing 8 bit 1sIt acts as a finish flag; the receiver will stop reading the remaining part of the message/telegram when receiving eight bits set to one in the NID_PACKET field.

Variable.Name: A_NVMAXREDADH1
Variable.DetailedName: Maximum deceleration under reduced adhesion conditions (1)
Variable.Description: Maximum deceleration under reduced adhesion conditions applicable for trains:With brake position Passenger train in P, andwith special/additional brakes independent from wheel/rail adhesion.This variable is part of the National Values

Variable.Name: A_NVMAXREDADH2
Variable.DetailedName: Maximum deceleration under reduced adhesion conditions (2)
Variable.Description: Maximum deceleration under reduced adhesion conditions applicable for trains:with brake position Passenger train in P, andwithout special/additional brakes independent from wheel/rail adhesion.This variable is part of the National Values

Variable.Name: A_NVMAXREDADH3
Variable.DetailedName: Maximum deceleration under reduced adhesion conditions (3)
Variable.Description: Maximum deceleration under reduced adhesion conditions applicable for trains with brake position Freight train in P, orwith brake position Freight train in G. This variable is part of the National Values

Variable.Name: A_NVP12
Variable.DetailedName: Lower deceleration limit to determine the set of Kv to be used
Variable.Description: Lower deceleration limit to determine the set of correction factor Kv to be used for Conventional Passenger trains.This variable is part of the National Values.

Variable.Name: A_NVP23
Variable.DetailedName: Upper deceleration limit to determine the set of Kv to be used
Variable.Description: Upper deceleration limit to determine the set of correction factor Kv to be used for Conventional Passenger trains.This variable is part of the National Values.

Variable.Name: D_ADHESION
Variable.DetailedName: Distance to start of area with reduced adhesion factor

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_AXLELOAD
Variable.DetailedName: Incremental distance to the start of the next Axle load speed profile

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_CURRENT
Variable.DetailedName: Distance to change of allowed current consumption

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_CYCLOC
Variable.DetailedName: Distance between two position reports from the train
Variable.Description: The train has to report its position every D_CYCLOC meters.

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Special.Description: The train has not to report cyclically its position.

Variable.Name: D_DP
Variable.DetailedName: Distance from the End of Authority to danger point

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_EMERGENCYSTOP
Variable.DetailedName: Distance to emergency stop location
Variable.Description: Distance between the LRBG and the emergency stop location

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_ENDTIMERSTARTLOC
Variable.DetailedName: Distance from End section timer start location to End of Authority

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_GRADIENT
Variable.DetailedName: Incremental distance to next change of gradient.

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_INFILL
Variable.DetailedName: Distance to location where to connect/disconnect to a radio infill unit

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_LEVELTR
Variable.DetailedName: Distance to level transition

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Special.Description: Now (The level transition is performed upon receipt of the order)

Variable.Name: D_LINK
Variable.DetailedName: Incremental linking distance to next linked balise group

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_LOC
Variable.DetailedName: Incremental distance between locations where the train has to report its position.

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_LOOP
Variable.DetailedName: Distance between EOLM and start of loop
Variable.Description: The EOLM specifies the distance to the beginning of the loop transmission

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_LRBG
Variable.DetailedName: Distance between the last relevant balise group and the estimated front end of the train (the side of the active cab).

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_LX
Variable.DetailedName: Distance to LX start location

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_MAMODE
Variable.DetailedName: Incremental distance to the start of the next Mode Profile

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_NVOVTRP
Variable.DetailedName: Maximum distance for overriding the train trip
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_NVPOTRP
Variable.DetailedName: Maximum distance for reversing in Post Trip mode
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_NVROLL
Variable.DetailedName: Roll away distance limit
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values and is used for Roll Away Protection and Reverse Movement Protection. Within the (national/default) limits of D_NVROLL the train may be moved for uncoupling.

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_NVSTFF
Variable.DetailedName: Maximum distance for running in Staff Responsible mode
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_OL
Variable.DetailedName: The distance from the End of Authority to the end of overlap

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_PBD
Variable.DetailedName: Permitted Braking Distance

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_PBDSR
Variable.DetailedName: Incremental distance to the start of the next speed restriction to ensure permitted braking distance

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_POSOFF
Variable.DetailedName: Offset from the location reference of the geographical position reference balise group to the related track kilometre reference.
Variable.Description: The geographical position reporting function uses this variables content as an offset from the location reference of the geographical position reference balise group to the related track kilometre reference.

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_RBCTR
Variable.DetailedName: Distance to RBC transition

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_REF
Variable.DetailedName: Reference distance
Variable.Description: Distance between the LRBG and the new shifted location reference.The positive values are in the nominal direction of the LRBGThe negative value are coded in 2's complement

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_REVERSE
Variable.DetailedName: Maximum distance to run in RV mode
Variable.Description: Distance from reference location to end location of the distance to run in RV mode

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_SECTIONTIMERSTOPLOC
Variable.DetailedName: Distance from beginning of section to the Section Time-out stop location

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_SR
Variable.DetailedName: Distance in SR mode
Variable.Description: Distance that can be run in SR mode

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_STARTOL
Variable.DetailedName: Distance from overlap timer start location to End of Authority

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_STARTREVERSE
Variable.DetailedName: Distance to start of reversing permitted area

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_STATIC
Variable.DetailedName: Incremental distance to next discontinuity in a international SSP profile

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_SUITABILITY
Variable.DetailedName: Distance to change in route suitability
Variable.Description: The incremental distance to where the route suitability data changes.

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_TAFDISPLAY
Variable.DetailedName: Distance from where on a track ahead free request shall be displayed

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_TEXTDISPLAY
Variable.DetailedName: Distance from where on a text shall be displayed

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Special.Description: The display of the text shall not be distance limited.

Variable.Name: D_TRACKINIT
Variable.DetailedName: Distance to start of empty profile
Variable.Description: Distance to where initial states of the related track description in the packet shall be resumed

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_TRACKCOND
Variable.DetailedName: Track condition distance
Variable.Description: The incremental distance to where the track conditions change.

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_TRACTION
Variable.DetailedName: Distance to change of traction

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_TSR
Variable.DetailedName: Distance to beginning of temporary speed restriction

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: D_VALIDNV
Variable.DetailedName: Distance to start of validity of national values

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: G_A
Variable.DetailedName: Safe gradient
Variable.Description: This is the absolute value of the minimum gradient between two defined locations.

Specs.Formula: 1 per mil

Special.Description: Non numerical value telling that the current gradient description ends at D_GRADIENT(n)

Variable.Name: G_PBDSR
Variable.DetailedName: Default gradient for PBD Speed restriction
Variable.Description: Defines a default gradient to be used for calculation of speed restriction to ensure permitted braking distance

Specs.Formula: 1 per mil

Variable.Name: G_TSR
Variable.DetailedName: Default gradient for TSR supervision
Variable.Description: defines a default gradient to be used for TSR supervision when no gradient profile (packet 21) is available.

Specs.Formula: 1 per mil

Variable.Name: L_ACKLEVELTR
Variable.DetailedName: Length of the acknowledgement area in rear of the required level

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: L_ACKMAMODE
Variable.DetailedName: Length of the acknowledgement area in rear of the start of the required mode

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: L_ADHESION
Variable.DetailedName: Length of reduced adhesion
Variable.Description: Length for which the reduced adhesion factor apply.

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: L_AXLELOAD
Variable.DetailedName: Length of speed restriction due to Axle load

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: L_DOUBTOVER
Variable.DetailedName: L_DOUBTOVER
Variable.Description: L_DOUBTOVER is the over-reading amount plus the Q_LOCACC of the LRBG

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: L_DOUBTUNDER
Variable.DetailedName: L_DOUBTUNDER
Variable.Description: L_DOUBTUNDER is the under-reading amount plus the Q_LOCACC of the LRBG

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: L_ENDSECTION
Variable.DetailedName: Length of the End section in the MA

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: L_LOOP
Variable.DetailedName: Length of loop
Variable.Description: L_LOOP specifies the length of the loop starting from the distance indicated by D_LOOP

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: L_LX
Variable.DetailedName: Length of the LX area

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: L_MAMODE
Variable.DetailedName: Length of the area of the required mode

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: L_MESSAGE
Variable.DetailedName: Message length
Variable.Description: L_MESSAGE indicates the length of the message in bytes, including all packets and all variables defined in the message header (NID_MESSAGE and L_MESSAGE also).

Specs.Formula: 1 Byte

Variable.Name: L_NVKRINT
Variable.DetailedName: Train length step used to define the integrated correction factor Kr
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Variable.Name: L_PACKET
Variable.DetailedName: Packet length
Variable.Description: L_PACKET indicates the length of the packet in bits, including all bits of the packet header

Specs.Formula: 1 bit

Variable.Name: L_PBDSR
Variable.DetailedName: Length of speed restriction to ensure permitted braking distance

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: L_REVERSEAREA
Variable.DetailedName: Length of the reversing permitted area

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: L_SECTION
Variable.DetailedName: Length of section in the MA

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: L_STOPLX
Variable.DetailedName: Length of the stopping area in rear of the start location of the LX area

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: L_TAFDISPLAY
Variable.DetailedName: Length on which a track ahead free request shall be displayed

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: L_TEXT
Variable.DetailedName: Length of text string
Variable.Description: L_TEXT defines the length of a text string (L_TEXT * X_TEXT)

Specs.Formula: 1 Text String Element

Variable.Name: L_TEXTDISPLAY
Variable.DetailedName: Length on which a text shall be displayed

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Special.Description: The display of the text shall not be distance limited.

Variable.Name: L_TRACKCOND
Variable.DetailedName: Length for which the defined track condition is valid

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: L_TRAIN
Variable.DetailedName: Train length
Variable.Description: This is the absolute real length of the train.

Specs.Formula: 1 m

Variable.Name: L_TRAININT
Variable.DetailedName: Safe Train length

Specs.Formula: 1 m

Variable.Name: L_TSR
Variable.DetailedName: Length of the temporary speed restriction

Specs.Formula: 10 cm, 1 m or 10 m depending on Q_SCALE

Variable.Name: M_ACK
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for acknowledgement request
Variable.Description: Indicates whether the telegram must be acknowledged or not

Variable.Name: M_ADHESION
Variable.DetailedName: Adhesion factor

Variable.Name: M_AIRTIGHT
Variable.DetailedName: airtight system presence
Variable.Description: indicates whether the train is fitted with an airtight system or not.

Variable.Name: M_AXLELOADCAT
Variable.DetailedName: Axle load category
Variable.Description: The values allocated below correspond to a list of increasing axle load categories (i.e. B1 > HS17, B2 > B1, D2 > C4 etc.) and it is used by the on-board equipment to compare its axle load category with the axle load category sent by trackside.For the underlying meaning of the axle load categories listed below (with the exception of HS17) refer to CR INF TSI.The category HS17 (axle load <= 17t) corresponds to a static load per axle only, as specified in HS RST TSI clause 4.2.3.2. The introduction of this artefact is necessary to ensure backward compatibility, without any negative performance impact, in case ASPs are used on lines operated with system version X = 1.

Variable.Name: M_CURRENT
Variable.DetailedName: Allowed current consumption
Variable.Description: It defines the allowed current consumption to be used by the train

Variable.Name: M_DUP
Variable.DetailedName: Duplicate balise
Variable.Description: Flags to tell whether the balise is a duplicate of one of the adjacent balises.

Special.Description: This balise is a duplicate of the next balise (seen in the nominal direction of the balise group).
This balise is a duplicate of the previous balise (seen in the nominal direction of the balise group).

Variable.Name: M_ERROR
Variable.DetailedName: Identifier of the type of error

Special.Description: Linked balise group: message consistency error(ref. 3.16.2.4.1/4)
Unlinked balise group: message consistency error (ref. 3.16.2.5)
Radio: safe radio connection error (ref. 3.16.3.4, to be sent when communication links re-established)

Variable.Name: M_LEVEL
Variable.DetailedName: Current Operating Level

Variable.Name: M_LEVELTEXTDISPLAY
Variable.DetailedName: Onboard operating level for text display
Variable.Description: The text is displayed when entering / as long as in the defined level

Special.Description: The display of the text shall not be limited by the level

Variable.Name: M_LEVELTR
Variable.DetailedName: Required level

Variable.Name: M_LINEGAUGE
Variable.DetailedName: Line gauge
Variable.Description: Defining which loading gauge(s) are permitted on a line (refer to TSI INF)

Variable.Name: M_LOADINGGAUGE
Variable.DetailedName: Loading gauge
Variable.Description: Defining the loading gauge profile of a train (refer to TSI RST)

Special.Description: The train does not fit to any of the interoperable loading gauge profiles

Variable.Name: M_LOC
Variable.DetailedName: Special location/moment where the train has to report its position

Special.Description: Now (The position report is sent upon receipt of the order)
Do not send position report on passage of LRBG compliant balise group.

Variable.Name: M_MAMODE
Variable.DetailedName: Required mode for a part of the MA

Variable.Name: M_MCOUNT
Variable.DetailedName: Message counter
Variable.Description: The purpose of this counter is to make it possible for the ERTMS/ETCS on-board to detect which balise group message the telegram belongs to.

Special.Description: The telegram never fits any message of the group
The telegram fits with all telegrams of the same balise group

Variable.Name: M_MODE
Variable.DetailedName: Onboard operating mode

Variable.Name: M_MODETEXTDISPLAY
Variable.DetailedName: Onboard operating mode for text display
Variable.Description: The text is displayed when entering / as long as in the defined mode

Special.Description: The display of the text shall not be limited by the mode.

Variable.Name: M_NVAVADH
Variable.DetailedName: Weighting factor for available wheel/rail adhesion
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values.

Variable.Name: M_NVCONTACT
Variable.DetailedName: T_NVCONTACT reaction
Variable.Description: Indicates the reaction to be performed when T_NVCONTACT timer elapsesThis variable is part of the National Values

Variable.Name: M_NVDERUN
Variable.DetailedName: Entry of Driver ID permitted while running
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Variable.Name: M_NVEBCL
Variable.DetailedName: Confidence level for emergency brake safe deceleration on dry rails
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values.Based on the required confidence level, the on-board equipment selects its corresponding rolling stock correction factor Kdry_rst(V).The confidence level on emergency brake safe deceleration represents the probability of the following individual event: the rolling stock emergency brake subsystem of the train does ensure a deceleration at least equal to A_brake_emergency(V) * Kdry_rst(V), when the emergency brake is commanded on dry rails.

Variable.Name: M_NVKRINT
Variable.DetailedName: Integrated correction factor Kr
Variable.Description: This is the train length dependent integrated correction factor.M_NVKRINT(l) is valid for a train length between L_NVKRINT(l) and L_NVKRINT(l+1).M_NVKRINT is valid between 0m and L_NVKRINT(1)This variable is part of the National Values

Variable.Name: M_NVKTINT
Variable.DetailedName: Integrated correction factor Kt
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Variable.Name: M_NVKVINT
Variable.DetailedName: Integrated correction factor Kv
Variable.Description: This is the speed dependent integrated correction factor.M_NVKVINT(n) is valid for an estimated speed between V_NVKVINT(n) and V_NVKVINT(n+1).M_NVKVINT is valid between 0 km/h and V_NVKVINT(1)This variable is part of the National Values

Variable.Name: M_PLATFORM
Variable.DetailedName: Type of platform
Variable.Description: Nominal height of platform above rail level (refer to TSI infrastructure)

Variable.Name: M_POSITION
Variable.DetailedName: Track kilometre reference value
Variable.Description: The geographical position reporting function uses this variables content as a reference value.

Specs.Formula: 1 m

Special.Description: No more geographical position calculation after this reference location

Variable.Name: M_TRACKCOND
Variable.DetailedName: Type of track condition

Special.Description: Non stopping area Initial state is stopping permitted
Tunnel stopping area Initial state is no tunnel stopping area
Sound horn Initial state is is no request for sound horn
Powerless section Lower pantograph Initial state is not powerless section
Radio hole stop supervising T_NVCONTACT Initial state is supervise T_NVCONTACT
Air tightness Initial state is no request for air tightness
Switch off regenerative brake Initial state is regenerative brake on
Switch off eddy current brake for service brake Initial state is eddy current brake for service brake on
Switch off magnetic shoe brake Initial state is magnetic shoe brake on
Powerless section switch off the main power switch Initial state is not powerless section
Switch off eddy current brake for emergency brake Initial state is eddy current brake for emergency brake on

Variable.Name: M_VOLTAGE
Variable.DetailedName: Traction System voltage
Variable.Description: It indicates the voltage of the traction system installed on a specific line or respectively that can be used by an engineThe identity of the traction system is given by M_VOLTAGE and, if M_VOLTAGE ? 0, by the country identifier of the traction system (NID_CTRACTION)

Special.Description: Line not fitted with any traction system

Variable.Name: M_VERSION
Variable.DetailedName: Version of ETCS system
Variable.Description: This gives the version of the ETCS systemEach part indicates the first and second number of the version respectively.The first number distinguishes not compatible versions. (The three MSBs)The second number indicates compatibility within a version X. (The four LSBs)

Special.Description: Previous versions according to e_g_ EEIG SRS and UIC A200 SRS
Version 1_0 introduced in SRS 1_2_0 and reused in SRSs 2_0_0 and 2_2_2 and 2_3_0
Reserved for future use (this is a valid value)
Reserved for future use (this is a valid value)

Variable.Name: N_AXLE
Variable.DetailedName: Axle number of the engine
Variable.Description: This gives the number of axles of the single unit (fixed train set or locomotive) in which the onboard equipment is fitted

Variable.Name: N_ITER
Variable.DetailedName: Number of iterations of a data set following this variable in a packet
Variable.Description: If N_ITER is 0 then no data set is following. Two nested levels of iterations can exist.

Variable.Name: N_PIG
Variable.DetailedName: Position in Group
Variable.Description: Defines the relative position in a balise group

Variable.Name: N_TOTAL
Variable.DetailedName: Total number of balise(s) in the group

Variable.Name: NC_CDDIFF
Variable.DetailedName: Cant Deficiency SSP category
Variable.Description: It is the Cant Deficiency SSP category for which a different value for the static line speed exists.Used together with V_DIFF to permit certain trains to go faster or lower than the international basic static speed given by V_STATIC.

Special.Description: Specific SSP applicable to Cant Deficiency 80 mm
Specific SSP applicable to Cant Deficiency 100 mm
Specific SSP applicable to Cant Deficiency 130 mm
Specific SSP applicable to Cant Deficiency 150 mm
Specific SSP applicable to Cant Deficiency 165 mm
Specific SSP applicable to Cant Deficiency 180 mm
Specific SSP applicable to Cant Deficiency 210 mm
Specific SSP applicable to Cant Deficiency 225 mm
Specific SSP applicable to Cant Deficiency 245 mm
Specific SSP applicable to Cant Deficiency 275 mm
Specific SSP applicable to Cant Deficiency 300 mm

Variable.Name: NC_CDTRAIN
Variable.DetailedName: Cant Deficiency Train Category
Variable.Description: Cant Deficiency Train category to which the train belongs.Thanks to NC_CDTRAIN, the train knows the Cant Deficiency SSP it must obey. By receiving a list of static speed profile, thanks to NC_CDDIFF, the train can select the Cant Deficiency SSP best suiting its NC_CDTRAIN.A train belongs to one and only one category of Cant Deficiency.

Variable.Name: NC_DIFF
Variable.DetailedName: Other specific SSP category
Variable.Description: It is the other specific SSP category for which a different value for the static line speed exists.Used together with V_DIFF to permit trains belonging to the corresponding other international train category to go faster or lower than the international basic static speed given by V_STATIC. Value 0 of NC_DIFF corresponds to the LSB of NC_TRAIN, value 14 of NC_DIFF to MSB (15-bit variable) of NC_TRAIN.

Special.Description: Specific SSP applicable to Freight train braked in P position
Specific SSP applicable to Freight train braked in G position
Specific SSP applicable to Passenger train

Variable.Name: NC_TRAIN
Variable.DetailedName: Other International Train Category
Variable.Description: Other train category (different from Cant Deficiency) to which the train belongs.Thanks to NC_TRAIN, the train knows the Other specific SSP category it must consider.By receiving a list of static speed profile, thanks to NC_DIFF, the train can select the SSP it must obey.Each bit represents one category.A train can belong to various categories.

Special.Description: Train does not belong to any of the Other International Train Category
Freight train braked in P position
Freight train braked in G position

Variable.Name: NID_BG
Variable.DetailedName: Identity number of the balise group
Variable.Description: Identity number of a balise group or loop within the country or region defined by NID_C.

Special.Description: Identity is unknown (only to be used for Linking information)

Variable.Name: NID_C
Variable.DetailedName: Identity number of the country or region
Variable.Description: Code used to identify the country or region in which the balise group, the RBC or the RIU is situated. These need not necessarily follow administrative or political boundaries.

Variable.Name: NID_CTRACTION
Variable.DetailedName: Country identifier of the traction system
Variable.Description: It identifies the information, additional to M_VOLTAGE, required to fully define the traction system.

Variable.Name: NID_EM
Variable.DetailedName: Emergency message identity
Variable.Description: Identifies the number of the emergency message

Variable.Name: NID_ENGINE
Variable.DetailedName: Onboard ETCS identity
Variable.Description: The ETCS identity number is uniquely defined for ERTMS/ETCS purposes

Variable.Name: NID_LOOP
Variable.DetailedName: Identity number of the loop
Variable.Description: Identity number of a loop within the country or region defined by NID_C given in the EOLM balise header.

Variable.Name: NID_LRBG
Variable.DetailedName: Identity of last relevant balise group
Variable.Description: Country/region identity (NID_C) + balise identity number of last relevant balise group (NID_BG).

Variable.Name: NID_LTRBG
Variable.DetailedName: Identity of the level 2/3 transition balise group
Variable.Description: Identity of the balise group at the level 2/3 transition location towards which the train is running.Country/region identity (NID_C) + balise identity number of the level 2/3 transition location balise group (NID_BG).

Variable.Name: NID_LX
Variable.DetailedName: Identity number of the Level Crossing.

Special.Description: Reserved for non RBC transmission (balise, loop or radio infill)

Variable.Name: NID_MESSAGE
Variable.DetailedName: Message identifier
Variable.Description: Message identifier. Regards defined values of NID_MESSAGE, refer to chapters 8.5.2 and 8.5.3

Variable.Name: NID_MN
Variable.DetailedName: Identity of Radio Network
Variable.Description: The NID_MN identifies the GSM-R network the calling mobile station has to register with. The NID_MN consists of up to 6 digits which are entered left adjusted into the data field, the leftmost digit is the digit to be dialled first. In case the NID_MN is shorter than 6 digits, the remaining space is to be filled with special character F. For further information about NID_MN refer to Subset-54.

Specs.Formula: Binary Coded Decimal

Special.Description: Use value F for digit to indicate no digit (if number shorter than 6 digits)

Variable.Name: NID_OPERATIONAL
Variable.DetailedName: Train Running Number
Variable.Description: This is the operational train running number. The NID_OPERATIONAL consists of up to 8 digits which are entered left adjusted into the data field, the leftmost digit is the digit to be entered first. In case the NID_OPERATIONAL is shorter than 8 digits, the remaining space is to be filled with special character F.

Specs.Formula: Binary Coded Decimal

Special.Description: Use value F for digit to indicate no digit (if number shorter than 8 digits)

Variable.Name: NID_PACKET
Variable.DetailedName: Packet identifier
Variable.Description: This is used in the header for each packet, allowing the receiving equipment to identify the data which follows. Regards defined values of NID_PACKET. Refer to packet numbers in the tables in chapter 7.4.1.

Variable.Name: NID_PRVLRBG
Variable.DetailedName: Identity of previous LRBG
Variable.Description: Previous LRBG detected when running towards the balise group identified as LRBG with no change of direction in-between.Country/region identity (NID_C) + balise identity number of the previous LRBG (NID_BG).

Variable.Name: NID_RADIO
Variable.DetailedName: Radio subscriber number.
Variable.Description: Quoted as a 16 digit decimal number. The number is to be entered left adjusted starting with the first digit to be dialled. Padding by the special value F shall be added after the least significant digit of the number. For further information about NID_RADIO refer to SUBSET-054.

Specs.Formula: Binary Coded Decimal

Special.Description: Use value F for digit to indicate no digit (if number shorter than 16 digits)
Use the short number stored onboard

Variable.Name: NID_RBC
Variable.DetailedName: RBC ETCS identity number
Variable.Description: This variable provides the identity of the RBC belonging to NID_C.The RBC ETCS identity is given by NID_C + NID_RBC.

Variable.Name: NID_RIU
Variable.DetailedName: Identity of radio infill unit
Variable.Description: This variable provides the identity of the RIU belonging to NID_C.The RIU ETCS identity is given by NID_C + NID_RIU.

Variable.Name: NID_NTC
Variable.DetailedName: National System identity
Variable.Description: Each value of this variable represents the identity of a National System.

Variable.Name: NID_TEXTMESSAGE
Variable.DetailedName: Text message identifier
Variable.Description: Identity of a text message from trackside to be used in a report of driver acknowledgement to the RBC

Variable.Name: NID_TSR
Variable.DetailedName: Identity number of Temporary Speed Restriction.

Special.Description: Reserved for non RBC transmission (balise, loop or radio infill)
Non-revocable speed restriction (applicable for all transmission media)

Variable.Name: NID_VBCMK
Variable.DetailedName: Marker for Virtual Balise Cover

Variable.Name: NID_XUSER
Variable.DetailedName: Identity of user system
Variable.Description: Identity of user system for which remainder of packet is intended.

Variable.Name: Q_ASPECT
Variable.DetailedName: Aspect of 'danger for shunting' signal

Variable.Name: Q_CONFTEXTDISPLAY
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for text confirmation versus end of text display
Variable.Description: Gives the relationship between the event driver acknowledgement and the list of events location, time, mode, level defining the end condition for text display

Special.Description: Driver acknowledgement always ends the text display, regardless of the end condition
Driver acknowledgement is an additional condition to end the display

Variable.Name: Q_DANGERPOINT
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for danger point description.
Variable.Description: This variable is set to 1 if either a danger point exists or a release speed has to be specified

Variable.Name: Q_DIFF
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for specific SSP categories.
Variable.Description: Indicates the type of specific SSP categoryIn case of other specific SSP, it tells ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment whether it replaces or not the Cant Deficiency SSP as selected by on-board (ref. 3.11.3.2.3), when the train belongs to an other international train category to which the other specific SSP applies

Special.Description: Other specific category, replaces the Cant Deficiency SSP
Other specific category, does not replace the Cant Deficiency SSP

Variable.Name: Q_DIR
Variable.DetailedName: Validity direction of transmitted data
Variable.Description: Qualifier to indicate the relevant validity direction of transmitted data, with reference to directionality of the balise group sending the information or to directionality of the LRBG, in case of information sent via radio.

Variable.Name: Q_DIRLRBG
Variable.DetailedName: Orientation of the train in relation to the direction of the LRBG

Variable.Name: Q_DIRTRAIN
Variable.DetailedName: Direction of train movement in relation to the LRBG orientation

Variable.Name: Q_DLRBG
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier telling on which side of the LRBG the estimated front end is

Variable.Name: Q_EMERGENCYSTOP
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for emergency stop acknowledgement
Variable.Description: Qualifier to inform the RBC about the use of emergency stop by on-board equipment.

Special.Description: Conditional Emergency Stop accepted, with update of EOA
Conditional Emergency Stop accepted, with no update of EOA
Emergency stop (Conditional or Unconditional) rejected, whatever the reason

Variable.Name: Q_ENDTIMER
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier to indicate whether end section timer information exists for the End section in the MA

Special.Description: End section timer information to follow

Variable.Name: Q_FRONT
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for validity end point of profile element
Variable.Description: Qualifier to indicate if a speed limit given for a profile element is to be applied until the front of the train (no train length delay) or the end of the train (train length delay) has left the element

Special.Description: Train length delay on validity end point of profile element.
No train length delay on validity end point of profile element

Variable.Name: Q_GDIR
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for gradient slope.

Variable.Name: Q_INFILL
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier to indicate whether a train is entering or exiting the radio infill area.

Variable.Name: Q_LENGTH
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for train integrity status
Variable.Description: Qualifier, identifying the train integrity information available. The related safe train length information is given by L_TRAININT

Special.Description: Train integrity confirmed by integrity monitoring device

Variable.Name: Q_LGTLOC
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for the specified report location
Variable.Description: This qualifier tells whether the train has to report its position when the max safe front end or when the min safe rear end has over passed the location defined by D_LOC

Variable.Name: Q_LINK
Variable.DetailedName: Link Qualifier
Variable.Description: This qualifier is used to mark a balise group as linked or unlinked.

Variable.Name: Q_LOCACC
Variable.DetailedName: Accuracy of the balise location
Variable.Description: This Qualifier defines the absolute value of the accuracy of the Balise location (i.e., the value 63m identifies a location accuracy of +/- 63m)

Specs.Formula: 1 m

Variable.Name: Q_LINKORIENTATION
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for the direction of the linked balise group
Variable.Description: Indicates whether the linked balise group will be overpassed by the train in nominal or reverse direction.

Special.Description: The balise group is seen by the train in reverse direction
The balise group is seen by the train in nominal direction

Variable.Name: Q_LINKREACTION
Variable.DetailedName: linking reaction
Variable.Description: Qualifier for the reaction to be performed if a linking or a balise group message consistency problem occurs with the balise group linked to.

Variable.Name: Q_LOOPDIR
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier to indicate the direction of the loop
Variable.Description: Indicates LOOP-reference direction in relation to EOLM direction

Variable.Name: Q_LXSTATUS
Variable.DetailedName: LX Protection Status
Variable.Description: Indicates whether the LX is protected or not

Variable.Name: Q_MAMODE
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier to indicate the supervision of the beginning of the mode profile
Variable.Description: This qualifier defines whether the beginning of the mode profile shall be considered either as the EOA (keeping the SvL given by the MA) or as both the EOA and SvL (instead of the EOA and SvL given by the MA).

Special.Description: as the EOA (keeping the SvL given by the MA)
as both the EOA and SvL (instead of the EOA and SvL given by the MA)

Variable.Name: Q_MARQSTREASON
Variable.DetailedName: Reason for MA request sending
Variable.Description: Qualifier to indicate the reason why the MA request is sent to the RBC

Special.Description: Time before reaching pre-indication location for the EOA/LOA reached
Time before a section timer/LOA speed timer expires reached
TAF up to level 2/3 transition location

Variable.Name: Q_MEDIA
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier to indicate the type of media
Variable.Description: Indicates whether it is a balise telegram or a loop message

Variable.Name: Q_MPOSITION
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for track kilometre direction.
Variable.Description: Qualifier to indicate the direction of counting of the geographical position track kilometre in relation to the geographical position reference balise group directionality.

Special.Description: Opposite (counting downwards if passed in nominal direction or counting upwards if passed in reverse direction)
Same (counting upwards if passed in nominal direction or counting downwards if passed in reverse direction)

Variable.Name: Q_NEWCOUNTRY
Variable.DetailedName: New Country Qualifier
Variable.Description: Qualifier to indicate whether the next balise group is in the same country / railway administration as the one before inside the packet or not.For the first balise group in the packet, if Q_NEWCOUNTRY = 0, it is the same country / railway administration as the one of the LRBG within the radio message, the one of balise group within the balise telegram giving the packet, or the one of the loop within the loop message giving the packet.

Special.Description: Same country / railway administration, no NID_C follows
Not the same country / railway administration, NID_C follows

Variable.Name: Q_NVDRIVER_ADHES
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for the modification of trackside adhesion factor by driver
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Variable.Name: Q_NVEMRRLS
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier Emergency Brake Release
Variable.Description: Permission to revoke the emergency brake command when the Permitted Speed limit is no longer exceeded or at standstill (for ceiling speed and target speed monitoring).This variable is part of the National Values

Special.Description: Revoke emergency brake command at standstill
Revoke emergency brake command when permitted speed supervision limit is no longer exceeded

Variable.Name: Q_NVGUIPERM
Variable.DetailedName: Permission to use the guidance curve
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Variable.Name: Q_NVINHSMICPERM
Variable.DetailedName: Permission to inhibit the compensation of the speed measurement inaccuracy
Variable.Description: Qualifier to inhibit the compensation of the speed measurement inaccuracy for the calculation of the EBI related supervision limits.This variable is part of the National Values

Variable.Name: Q_NVKINT
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for integrated correction factors
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Variable.Name: Q_NVKVINTSET
Variable.DetailedName: Type of Kv_int set

Variable.Name: Q_NVLOCACC
Variable.DetailedName: Default accuracy of the balise location (absolute value)
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Specs.Formula: 1 m

Variable.Name: Q_NVSBFBPERM
Variable.DetailedName: Permission to use the service brake feedback
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Variable.Name: Q_NVSBTSMPERM
Variable.DetailedName: Permission to use service brake in target speed monitoring
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Variable.Name: Q_ORIENTATION
Variable.DetailedName: Co-ordinate system assigned to a single balise group
Variable.Description: The co-ordinate system is assigned by the RBC to a balise group reported by the on-board equipment as LRBG. The information reverse/nominal (i.e., the assigned co-ordinate system) is given in relation to the direction in which the balise has been passed when reading it.

Special.Description: The balise group has been passed by the train in reverse direction
The balise group has been passed by the train in nominal direction

Variable.Name: Q_OVERLAP
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier to tell whether there is an overlap
Variable.Description: This variable is set to 1 if either an overlap exists or a release speed has to be specified

Variable.Name: Q_PBDSR
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for Permitted Braking Distance
Variable.Description: Qualifier defining whether the permitted braking distance is to be achieved with the Service Brake or Emergency Brake

Variable.Name: Q_PLATFORM
Variable.DetailedName: Platform position (relative to direction of authorised movement)

Variable.Name: Q_RBC
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for communication session order

Variable.Name: Q_RIU
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for communication session order

Variable.Name: Q_SCALE
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for the distance scale.
Variable.Description: Qualifier to indicate the same scale used for describing all distances inside the packet that contains Q_SCALE.

Variable.Name: Q_SECTIONTIMER
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier to indicate whether there is a Section Time-Out related to the section

Variable.Name: Q_SLEEPSESSION
Variable.DetailedName: Session management for sleeping equipment
Variable.Description: Qualifier for a Sleeping onboard equipment to execute or not the session establishment order

Variable.Name: Q_SRSTOP
Variable.DetailedName: Stop if in Staff Responsible information
Variable.Description: Specifies whether an onboard equipment in staff responsible has to stop or not

Variable.Name: Q_SSCODE
Variable.DetailedName: Spread Spectrum Code for Euroloop
Variable.Description: Specifies the code required to receive telegrams from a specific Euroloop installation.

Variable.Name: Q_STATUS
Variable.DetailedName: status of SoM position report
Variable.Description: It provides the status of the position report

Variable.Name: Q_STOPLX
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for stopping in rear of the LX
Variable.Description: Indicates whether stopping the train in rear of a non protected LX is required

Variable.Name: Q_SUITABILITY
Variable.DetailedName: Type of route suitability data

Variable.Name: Q_TEXT
Variable.DetailedName: Fixed message to be displayed.
Variable.Description: Q_TEXT is a pointer to select a fixed text message from the defined table. The language selected by the driver for the DMI shall be used additionally as a qualifier to choose the appropriate language table.

Variable.Name: Q_TEXTCLASS
Variable.DetailedName: Class of message to be displayed.
Variable.Description: Q_TEXTCLASS specifies the class of the text message included in the same packet (either plain or fixed message)

Variable.Name: Q_TEXTCONFIRM
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for text confirmation

Special.Description: Confirmation required: command application of the service brake when display end condition is fulfilled, unless the text has already been acknowledged by the driver
Confirmation required: command application of the emergency brake when display end condition is fulfilled, unless the text has already been acknowledged by the driver

Variable.Name: Q_TEXTDISPLAY
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for the combination of text message eventss
Variable.Description: Q_TEXTDISPLAY defines whether the start/end events for text message are to be combined or not

Special.Description: No, display as soon as / until one of the events is fulfilled
Yes, display as soon as / until all events are fulfilled

Variable.Name: Q_TEXTREPORT
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for reporting acknowledgement of text by driver

Variable.Name: Q_TRACKINIT
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for resuming the initial states of the related track description of the packet.

Special.Description: No initial states to be resumed, profile to follow
Empty profile, initial states to be resumed

Variable.Name: Q_UPDOWN
Variable.DetailedName: Balise telegram transmission direction
Variable.Description: It defines the direction of the information in the balise telegram

Variable.Name: Q_VBCO
Variable.DetailedName: Qualifier for Virtual Balise Cover order
Variable.Description: Qualifier to set or remove a VBC

Variable.Name: T_CYCLOC
Variable.DetailedName: Time Interval between two position reports sent by the train
Variable.Description: The train must send its position every T_CYCLOC

Specs.Formula: 1 s

Variable.Name: T_CYCRQST
Variable.DetailedName: Time between two cyclic requests for a movement authority
Variable.Description: When the train asks for a movement authority request, it will repeat its request every T_CYCRQST seconds until it receives a new MA

Specs.Formula: 1 s

Variable.Name: T_ENDTIMER
Variable.DetailedName: Validity time for the End section in the MA
Variable.Description: Time for which the End section is valid measured from the moment the train reaches the location defined by D_ENDTIMERSTARTLOC.

Specs.Formula: 1 s

Variable.Name: T_LOA
Variable.DetailedName: Validity time for the target speed at the LOA
Variable.Description: Time for which the target speed is valid measured from the moment information is received

Specs.Formula: 1 s

Variable.Name: T_MAR
Variable.DetailedName: Time before reaching pre-indication location for the EOA/LOA

Specs.Formula: 1 s

Special.Description: No MA request triggering with regards to this function

Variable.Name: T_NVCONTACT
Variable.DetailedName: Maximal time without new safe message.
Variable.Description: If no safe message has been received from the track for more than T_NVCONTACT seconds, an appropriate action according to M_NVCONTACT must be triggered.This variable is part of the National Values

Specs.Formula: 1 s

Variable.Name: T_NVOVTRP
Variable.DetailedName: Maximum time for overriding the train trip
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Specs.Formula: 1 s

Variable.Name: T_OL
Variable.DetailedName: Overlap validity time
Variable.Description: The time span the train can expect the overlap to be available, measured from the moment the train reaches the location defined by D_STARTOL.

Specs.Formula: 1 s

Variable.Name: T_SECTIONTIMER
Variable.DetailedName: Validity time of a section in the MA
Variable.Description: Time for which the section is valid.

Specs.Formula: 1 s

Variable.Name: T_TEXTDISPLAY
Variable.DetailedName: Duration for which a text shall be displayed

Specs.Formula: 1 s

Special.Description: Display of text not limited by time.

Variable.Name: T_TIMEOUTRQST
Variable.DetailedName: Time before any section timer expires or the LOA speed timer expires

Specs.Formula: 1 s

Special.Description: No MA request triggering with regards to this function

Variable.Name: T_TRAIN
Variable.DetailedName: Trainborne clock
Variable.Description: Time, according to trainborne clock, at which message is sent

Specs.Formula: 10 ms

Variable.Name: T_VBC
Variable.DetailedName: VBC validity period

Specs.Formula: 1 day

Variable.Name: V_AXLELOAD
Variable.DetailedName: Speed restriction related to axleload

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_DIFF
Variable.DetailedName: Absolute Positive Speed associated to a train category.

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_LOA
Variable.DetailedName: Permitted speed at the limit of authority

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_LX
Variable.DetailedName: Permitted speed for the LX speed restriction
Variable.Description: Speed at which the LX can be passed when it is not protected

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_MAIN
Variable.DetailedName: Signalling related speed restriction

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_MAMODE
Variable.DetailedName: Required mode related speed

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Special.Description: Use the national speed value of the required mode

Variable.Name: V_MAXTRAIN
Variable.DetailedName: Maximum train speed.

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_NVALLOWOVTRP
Variable.DetailedName: Speed limit allowing the driver to select the override function
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_NVKVINT
Variable.DetailedName: Speed step used to define the integrated correction factor Kv
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_NVLIMSUPERV
Variable.DetailedName: Limited Supervision mode speed limit
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_NVONSIGHT
Variable.DetailedName: On Sight mode speed limit
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_NVSUPOVTRP
Variable.DetailedName: Override speed limit to be supervised when the override function is active
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_NVREL
Variable.DetailedName: Release Speed
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_NVSHUNT
Variable.DetailedName: Shunting mode speed limit
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_NVSTFF
Variable.DetailedName: Staff Responsible mode speed limit
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_NVUNFIT
Variable.DetailedName: Unfitted mode speed limit
Variable.Description: This variable is part of the National Values

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_RELEASEDP
Variable.DetailedName: Release speed associated with the danger point

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_RELEASEOL
Variable.DetailedName: Release speed associated with the overlap

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_REVERSE
Variable.DetailedName: Reversing mode speed limit

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_STATIC
Variable.DetailedName: Basic static speed profile
Variable.Description: Basic static speed profile speed after discontinuity (k).

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Special.Description: Non numerical value telling that the static speed profile description ends at D_STATIC(n)

Variable.Name: V_TRAIN
Variable.DetailedName: Train speed

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: V_TSR
Variable.DetailedName: Permitted speed for the temporary speed restriction

Specs.Formula: 5 km/h

Variable.Name: X_TEXT
Variable.DetailedName: Text String Element
Variable.Description: Text strings are used to transmit plain text messages. Each element of a text string contains a single character encoded as ISO 8859-1, also known as Latin Alphabet #1.
